, and from there it's conveniently accessible by train, bus, or car.

value: name=The Children's Ferrite and Science Museum
alt=フェライト子ども科学館
directions=On the south side of Highway 7 in central Kisakata.  The large glass spire-like structure is clearly visible from the road.

content=This is a small science museum.  There are many hands-on exhibits involving magnets, sound, and various other topics.  A few exhibits have information in English.  Outside, there is a large trampoline and jungle gym.
name=Shirase South Pole Expedition Memorial Hall
alt=白瀬南極探検隊記念館
content=A memorial for Nobu Shirase, a man from Konoura, who led the first Japanese expedition to the South Pole.
address=日本 秋田県にかほ市金浦中谷地２０−１
directions=Just SE of Highway 7 between Konoura and Kisakata.  Near Nikaho High School.
directions=Take Highway 58 SE from Kisakata about 13km from the Highway 7 junction.  Located behind Nakajimadai Forest Recreation Campground.

content=This wetlands area is a great spot for hiking in the woods.  Some of the trees here are centuries old and famous for their age.  The hiking trails are mostly tree-covered, and some of the streams naturally have a slightly bluish color.  The most popular route is a well-signed 5km loop.
directions=From Highway 7 in Kisakata, take Highway 58 east for 5km, then go south on Highway 131 for 1km.
content=This is a 26m waterfall.  Not far from the waterfall is the Kinpo Shrine.
content=This is a 30m wide low waterfall.  The wide low waterfall creates a mist, which contrasts with the green moss.

content=This farm has a restaurant that serves lamb, among other things.  It also has soft-serve ice cream, as well as cheese and sausage.  In a separate building, there is a small petting zoo.  Outdoor benches provide nice views of the plateau and surrounding mountains.
directions=South of the Nikaho Branch Office, just east of Nikaho Junior High School.
content=The owner makes excellent food, including fresh udon, soba, rice bread, and rice bread pizza.
alt=寿し割烹うなぎ笹乃井
directions=Exit Nikaho Station and turn right.  The restaurant is just past the JA Akita Shinsei building.
price=Lunch and specials for ¥1000-1500; dinner for up to ¥5,000
content=This is a sushi restaurant with good sushi and friendly owners.
directions=From Kisakata Station, go west half a block.  The bar is on the north side of the road.
content=This bar has a mild pirate theme, and is said to have very friendly staff and customers.
directions=On the north side of Highway 7 between Nikaho and Konoura.
price=¥12,000 for one night and two meals; specials available
content=An upscale ryokan with onsen.  Large rooms can be reserved for enkais.
alt=中島台レクリエーションの森キャンプ場
directions=Take Highway 58 SE from Kisakata, turning as necessary to stay on Highway 58.  This campground is about 13 km from the Highway 7 junction.
content=This campground is located on the foot of Mt. Chokai, next to the Shishigahana Wetlands, a great hiking spot.
directions=300m S/SW of the Kisakata Michi no Eki
content=This is a hotel and onsen overlooking the Sea of Japan.  Rooms are Japanese style, with futon mattresses on a tatami floor.
Take the overnight train north to
